strings.Value: "Can I see your wares?"
"What's causing all the fuss around here?"
"Who is in charge of this village?"
"I'm surprised to see a trader in such a remote place."
[Attack] "I didn't come to talk."
"I'll come another time. Farewell!"
"Hmm, these wares don't look like hunting trophies. They remind me more of some robber's loot."
"Now you're trying to bribe me? If you ever even think of going back to your old ways, you'll find yourself in some real trouble."
"Why don't you start with where you acquired these goods of yours?"
"Donations are always appreciated."
"Your suspicions about Ivar weren't unfounded. He wasn't some dragon's messenger — he was a werewolf."
[Attack] "Not only are you selling stolen wares, but now you're trying to bribe your way out of justice? I can't let that go unpunished!"
"No, I let him live."
"Yes, and good riddance."
"I dealt with your bandit buddies from that cave. They're gone."
"How I dealt with him is none of your business."
"You sent me a letter, right? About hunter named Ivar and his Silver Dragon stories?"
"Welcome to Brevis's Roadside Shop!" {n}Judging from his accent and his fine clothes, this trader isn't from around here.{/n}

{n}The trader smirks.{/n} "Ivar. He's a resourceful one, to be sure. Made the whole area believe he's some chosen one, the spokesman for the 'Silver Dragon.' The idiots around here listen to everything he says and do whatever he asks."

"It's strange, though. After this Ivar fellow came to the village with his sack of silver scales and his ridiculous stories about the Silver Dragon, things in the area started to change. There was this wolf pack, used to cut through the local cattle like a housewife cuts through vegetables. After Ivar got here, the wolves won't even come close to the local cows. Same with the monsters in the woods — they don't take step one toward the village or its people. It's all pretty strange, if you ask me. Very strange, indeed."

"You mean those fish jumping ashore?" {n}The trader frowns.{/n} "These fools believe it's thanks to their 'patron,' the Silver Dragon. He supposedly decided to provide the villagers with a feast and sent them this 'gift.' Idiots. I don't know the real reason those fish are jumping, but if it were me, I wouldn't get too close to those fish or that lake."
"I usually buy hides from the local hunters, but sometimes they come up with some rather... intriguing trophies. No wonder, though, considering the number of different beasts living in these woods."

{n}The trader's face goes blank.{/n} "I'm sure I have no idea what you mean, Your {mf|Grace|Grace|Highness|Highness}. This is all pretty standard trade around these parts. You know, totally unrelated, I just realized I haven't had an opportunity before to offer a donation to help support our barony..."
{n}The trader smiles broadly.{/n} "Just the usual junk, Your Grace. I buy it from travelers I come across here and there."
"So nice doing business with you, Your {mf|Grace|Grace|Highness|Highness}!"
"A werewolf! So that's who-" {n}The trader cuts himself short, then spits.{/n} "I hope you killed the beast."

{n}The trader glances at you suspiciously.{/n} "All right, all right! There's a cave to the north. Some... less than law-abiding fellows have taken up residence there. If we're being uncharitable, you could call them bandits. I sell things they've collected. But I never robbed anyone myself! You've my word of honor on that!"
"Sure, yes, of course!" {n}The trader's voice rings with enthusiasm.{/n}
"That was a... shortsighted decision." {n}The trader's voice carries a tone of sarcasm, but he quickly restrains himself.{/n} "Your {mf|Grace|Grace|Highness|Highness}."
"It's been a long time since I heard such good news! If you'll permit me, {mf|baron|baroness|king|queen}, I'd like to give you a gift, a sign of my gratitude."
{n}The trader's glance betrays no emotion.{/n} "They were no buddies of mine! Fewer bandits means calmer trading..." {n}The trader trails off with a grunt.{/n}
"Of course, Your {mf|Grace|Grace|Highness|Highness}, of course! None of my business at all."
"Who are you trying to fool, you slime? H{mf|is|er} {mf|Grace|Grace|Highness|Highness}, me, or my blade?"
{n}Valerie meaningfully places her hand on her weapon.{/n} "Would you like to press your luck, liar?"
{n}Valerie's lips purse with disdain.{/n} "Those like him think anything can be bought — even laws and rulers."
{n}Valerie glances pensively at you.{/n} "Do you believe he will keep his word? Though on second thought, I know how convincing you can be."
"Aaaaah!"
"And I can see you do not mind taking justice into your own hands!"
"How low."
